definition: mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide

tiger tally (a two-piece object made in the shape of a tiger, used in ancient China as proof of authority. One half of a tally could be issued to a military officer and this would be matched with the other half when verification was required.)
arrow banner of command (archaic used as symbol of military authority)/fig. instructions from one's superiors
(archaic) wooden or metal token of authority/(fig.) decree/directive/(computing) token
official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
golden seal/characters tattooed on a convict's face
imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill
